intro: Oenothera runcinata var. leucotricha, commonly known as the white-stemmed evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Oenothera runcinata var. leucotricha is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for nocturnal pollinators.
